title: CANAL ORB / faln at night
description: idiot doom spiral story reaction orb -- the faln rider (not) appearing at the canal at night.

dialogueTree.title: Inland Empire: "The Headless FALN Rider -- he could..."
dialogueTree.english: The Headless FALN Rider -- he could appear at any minute!
dialogueTree.polish: Bezgłowy jeździec FALN. Może pojawić się tu lada moment!
dialogueTree.belarusian: Бязгалоўны вершнік ФАЛН. Можа з'явіцца тут у любы момант!

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Please tell me we're not here to l..."
links.english: "Please tell me we're not here to look for a headless man in a tracksuit riding a horse... because there's no such thing."
links.polish: „Proszę, powiedz, że nie jesteśmy tu, aby szukać bezgłowego mężczyzny w dresie na koniu... Bo nikt taki nie istnieje”.
links.belarusian: "Калі ласка, скажы, што мы тут не для таго, каб шукаць безгаловага мужчыну ў спартовым касцюме на кані... Бо ніхто такі не існуе".

links.title: Inland Empire: "Don't listen to the lieutenant! He..."
links.english: Don't listen to the lieutenant! He doesn't know *anything*.
links.polish: Nie słuchaj porucznika! *Na niczym* się nie zna.
links.belarusian: Не слухай лейтэнанта! *Ні ў чым* не разбіраецца.

links.title: You: ""How would you know?""
links.english: "How would you know?"
links.polish: „Skąd to niby wiesz?”
links.belarusian: "Адкуль ты нібыта гэта ведаеш?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No one's actually *seen* the Headl..."
links.english: "No one's actually *seen* the Headless FALN Rider because he doesn't exist. He's an urban legend. A *legend*, meaning a story that's not real."
links.polish: „Nikt nigdy nie *widział* bezgłowego jeźdźca FALN, bo on nie istnieje. To miejska legenda. *Legenda*, czyli opowieść, która nie jest prawdziwa”.
links.belarusian: "Ніхто ніколі не *бачыў* бязглавага вершніка ФАЛН, бо ён не існуе. Гэта гарадская легенда. *Легенда*, г.зн. аповяд, які не з'яўляецца праўдзівым".

links.title: You: ""We'll just wait and see.""
links.english: "We'll just wait and see."
links.polish: „Poczekamy i zobaczymy”.
links.belarusian: "Пачакайма і пабачым".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""There's nothing to wait for. We sh..."
links.english: "There's nothing to wait for. We should get some rest, it's been a long day."
links.polish: „Nie ma na co czekać. Powinniśmy odpocząć – to był długi dzień”.
links.belarusian: "Няма на што чакаць. Мы павінны адпачыць — гэта быў доўгі дзень".

links.title: You: ""I'm just going to wait a few more..."
links.english: "I'm just going to wait a few more minutes, just in case."
links.polish: „Poczekam jeszcze kilka minut, tak na wszelki wypadek”.
links.belarusian: "Пачакаю яшчэ некалькі хвілін, так на ўсялякі выпадак".

links.title: Inland Empire: "Yes, stay! What's a few more minute..."
links.english: Yes, stay! What's a few more minutes going to hurt?
links.polish: Tak, zostań! Co ci tych kilka minut robi za różnicę?
links.belarusian: Так, заставайся! Што табе робяць гэтыя некалькі хвілін розніцы?

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant has his arms crossed..."
links.english: The lieutenant has his arms crossed, fingers tapping against his bicep. "There, we waited. Nothing happened. Happy now?"
links.polish: Porucznik ma ręce skrzyżowane na piersi i postukuje ze zniecierpliwieniem palcami w swój biceps. „No to poczekaliśmy. Nic się nie wydarzyło. Zadowolony?”
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант скрыжаваў рукі на грудзі і з нецярпеннем пастуквае пальцамі па сваім біцэпсе. "Ну вось і дачакаліся. Нічога не здарылася. Задаволены?"

links.title: You: "There's nothing here -- You lied to..."
links.english: There's nothing here -- You lied to me!
links.polish: Nic tu nie ma. Okłamałeś mnie!
links.belarusian: Тут нічога няма. Ты мне падмануў!

links.title: Inland Empire: "Your ears hum from the silence insi..."
links.english: Your ears hum from the silence inside your mind...
links.polish: Cisza w twoim umyśle przyprawia cię o dzwonienie w uszach...
links.belarusian: Цішыня ў тваіх думках выклікае звон у вушах...

links.title: You: ""This has made me unspeakably unhap..."
links.english: "This has made me unspeakably unhappy."
links.polish: „Jestem niewyobrażalnie wręcz zadowolony”.
links.belarusian: "Я проста неверагодна задаволены".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I know myths and legends are entic..."
links.english: "I know myths and legends are enticing, but in the end they're just stories for children... to teach them lessons, or to frighten them." He gestures toward the waves.
links.polish: „Wiem, że mity i legendy są pociągające, ale to tylko opowieści dla dzieci... Mają je czegoś nauczyć lub wystraszyć” – wyjaśnia, gestykulując w kierunku fal.
links.belarusian: "Ведаю, што міфы і легенды прывабныя, але гэта толькі апавяданні для дзяцей... Яны павінны нечага навучыць або спалохаць", — тлумачыць, жэстыкулюючы ў бок хваляў.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Let's go. It's very late -- we sho..."
links.english: "Let's go. It's very late -- we should be resting already. Tomorrow will be another tough day."
links.polish: „Chodźmy już. Zrobiło się bardzo późno – w tej chwili powinniśmy być już w łóżkach. Przed nami kolejny ciężki dzień”.
links.belarusian: "Давайце пойдзем. Сёння стала вельмі позна — зараз мы павінны быць ужо ў ложках. Наперадзе ў нас яшчэ адзін цяжкі дзень".

links.title: You: ""You were right, Kim. What was I th..."
links.english: "You were right, Kim. What was I thinking? Let's go." [Leave.]
links.polish: „Miałeś rację, Kim. Co ja sobie myślałem? Chodźmy już”. [Odejdź].
links.belarusian: "Ты меў рацыю, Кім. Што я сабе думаў? Пойдзем ужо". [Адыдзі].

links.title: You: ""You're right, what was I thinking?..."
links.english: "You're right, what was I thinking? Let's go." [Leave.]
links.polish: „Masz rację. Co ja sobie myślałem? Chodźmy już”. [Odejdź].
links.belarusian: "Ты маеш рацыю. Што я сабе думаў? Хадзем ўжо". [Адыходзь].

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant nods."
links.english: The lieutenant nods.
links.polish: Porucznik kiwa głową.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант ківае галавой.

links.title: You: ""Yeah, you're right. Would've been..."
links.english: "Yeah, you're right. Would've been cool, though, don't you think?"
links.polish: „Tak, racja. Ale byłoby czadowo, nie uważasz?”
links.belarusian: "Так, сапраўды. Але было б крута, ці не так?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, it would have been *very* coo..."
links.english: "Yes, it would have been *very* cool." The lieutenant nods. "Now let's get some rest."
links.polish: „Tak, byłoby *bardzo* czadowo” – kiwa głową porucznik. „A teraz chodźmy już spać”.
links.belarusian: "Так, гэта было б *вельмі* крута", — ківае галавой лейтэнант. "А цяпер пайдзем спаць".

links.title: You: ""No, we're just passing through.""
links.english: "No, we're just passing through."
links.polish: „Nie, po prostu tędy przechodzimy”.
links.belarusian: "Не, мы проста праходзім тут".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Good. It's late, we should get som..."
links.english: "Good. It's late, we should get some rest."
links.polish: „To dobrze. Jest późno, powinniśmy iść spać”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта добра. Позна, мы павінны ісці спаць".

links.title: You: ""Absolutely not. That's not why we'..."
links.english: "Absolutely not. That's not why we're here. Why would you even think that?"
links.polish: „W żadnym razie. Nie po to tu jesteśmy. Skąd w ogóle taka myśl?”
links.belarusian: "Ні ў якім разе. Не для гэтага мы тут. Адкуль наогул такая думка?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We've been running around together..."
links.english: "We've been running around together doing *odd things* for days. I've seen how your mind operates... this is just the sort of thing it would latch on to."
links.polish: „Biegaliśmy razem, robiąc różne *dziwne rzeczy* przez cały dzień. Widziałem twój umysł w akcji... To jest jedna z tych rzeczy, których mógłbyś się uczepić”.
links.belarusian: "Мы разам бегалі, рабілі розныя *дзіўныя рэчы* цэлы дзень. Я бачыў тваю думку ў дзеянні... Гэта адна з тых рэчаў, за якія ты мог бы зачапіцца".

links.title: You: ""I admit... it is a thing I would *..."
links.english: "I admit... it is a thing I would *usually* do. But not this time."
links.polish: „Przyznam, że... to coś, co *zazwyczaj* bym zrobił. Ale nie tym razem”.
links.belarusian: "Прызнаю, што... гэта тое, што *звычайна* я б зрабіў. Але не гэтым разам".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Good. It's already late, we need t..."
links.english: "Good. It's already late, we need to get some rest. Tomorrow will be another tough day."
links.polish: „To dobrze. Jest już późno, a my potrzebujemy wypoczynku. Przed nami kolejny ciężki dzień”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта добра. Ужо позна, а нам патрэбны адпачынак. Наперадзе ў нас чарговы цяжкі дзень".

links.title: You: ""Okay, you got me. I had a hope...""
links.english: "Okay, you got me. I had a hope..."
links.polish: „No dobra, przyznaję. Miałem nadzieję...”
links.belarusian: "Ну добра, прызнаю. Спадзяваўся..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""...a foolish hope. But it's okay...."
links.english: "...a foolish hope. But it's okay. I get it. It would have been *cool*." The lieutenant nods. "Now let's get some rest."
links.polish: „Naiwną nadzieję. Ale to nic. Rozumiem. To byłoby *czadowe*” – kiwa głową porucznik. „A teraz chodźmy już spać”.
links.belarusian: "Наіўная надзея. Але нічога. Разумею. Гэта было б *крута*", — ківае галавой лейтэнант. "А цяпер пайшлі ўжо спаць".
